readme:
# ion-searchbar

Searchbars represent a text field that can be used to search through a collection. They can be displayed inside of a toolbar or the main content.

A Searchbar should be used instead of an input to search lists. A clear button is displayed upon entering input in the searchbar's text field. Clicking on the clear button will erase the text field and the input will remain focused. A cancel button can be enabled which will clear the input and lose the focus upon click.
docs:
Searchbars represent a text field that can be used to search through a collection. They can be displayed inside of a toolbar or the main content.

A Searchbar should be used instead of an input to search lists. A clear button is displayed upon entering input in the searchbar's text field. Clicking on the clear button will erase the text field and the input will remain focused. A cancel button can be enabled which will clear the input and lose the focus upon click.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

usage.angular:
```html
<!-- Default Searchbar -->
<ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button always shown -->
<ion-searchbar showCancelButton="always"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button never shown -->
<ion-searchbar showCancelButton="never"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button shown on focus -->
<ion-searchbar showCancelButton="focus"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with danger color -->
<ion-searchbar color="danger"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with value -->
<ion-searchbar value="Ionic"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with telephone type -->
<ion-searchbar type="tel"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with numeric inputmode -->
<ion-searchbar inputmode="numeric"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar disabled -->
<ion-searchbar disabled="true"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a cancel button and custom cancel button text -->
<ion-searchbar showCancelButton="focus" cancelButtonText="Custom Cancel"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a custom debounce -->
<ion-searchbar debounce="500"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Animated Searchbar -->
<ion-searchbar animated></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a placeholder -->
<ion-searchbar placeholder="Filter Schedules"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar in a Toolbar -->
<ion-toolbar>
  <ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>
</ion-toolbar>
```
usage.javascript:
```html
<!-- Default Searchbar -->
<ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button always shown -->
<ion-searchbar show-cancel-button="always"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button never shown -->

<!-- Searchbar with cancel button shown on focus -->

<!-- Searchbar with danger color -->
<ion-searchbar color="danger"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with value -->

<!-- Searchbar with telephone type -->
<ion-searchbar type="tel"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with numeric inputmode -->
<ion-searchbar inputmode="numeric"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar disabled -->
<ion-searchbar disabled="true"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a cancel button and custom cancel button text -->
<ion-searchbar show-cancel-button="focus" cancel-button-text="Custom Cancel"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a custom debounce -->
<ion-searchbar debounce="500"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Animated Searchbar -->
<ion-searchbar animated></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar with a placeholder -->
<ion-searchbar placeholder="Filter Schedules"></ion-searchbar>

<!-- Searchbar in a Toolbar -->
<ion-toolbar>
  <ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>
</ion-toolbar>
```
usage.vue:
```html
<template>
  <!-- Default Searchbar -->
  <ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>
  
  <!-- Searchbar with cancel button always shown -->
  <ion-searchbar showCancelButton="always"></ion-searchbar>
  
  <!-- Searchbar with cancel button never shown -->
  <ion-searchbar showCancelButton="never"></ion-searchbar>
  
  <!-- Searchbar with cancel button shown on focus -->
  <ion-searchbar showCancelButton="focus"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with danger color -->
  <ion-searchbar color="danger"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with value -->
  <ion-searchbar value="Ionic"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with telephone type -->
  <ion-searchbar type="tel"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with numeric inputmode -->
  <ion-searchbar inputmode="numeric"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar disabled -->
  <ion-searchbar disabled="true"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with a cancel button and custom cancel button text -->
  <ion-searchbar showCancelButton="focus" cancelButtonText="Custom Cancel"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with a custom debounce -->
  <ion-searchbar debounce="500"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Animated Searchbar -->
  <ion-searchbar animated></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar with a placeholder -->
  <ion-searchbar placeholder="Filter Schedules"></ion-searchbar>

  <!-- Searchbar in a Toolbar -->
  <ion-toolbar>
    <ion-searchbar></ion-searchbar>
  </ion-toolbar>
</template>
```

props.name: cancelButtonIcon
props.docs: Set the cancel button icon. Only applies to `md` mode.

props.name: cancelButtonText
props.docs: Set the the cancel button text. Only applies to `ios` mode.

props.name: clearIcon
props.docs: Set the clear icon. Defaults to `"close-circle"` for `ios` and `"close"` for `md`.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionChange` event after each keystroke.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

props.name: inputmode
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs:
Set the input's placeholder.
`placeholder` can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string.
To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they
must be escaped. For example `<Ionic>` would become
`<Ionic>`

For more information: [Security Documentation](https://ionicframework.com/docs/faq/security)

props.name: searchIcon
props.docs: The icon to use as the search icon.

props.name: showCancelButton
props.docs:
Sets the behavior for the cancel button. Defaults to `"never"`.
Setting to `"focus"` shows the cancel button on focus.
Setting to `"never"` hides the cancel button.
Setting to `"always"` shows the cancel button regardless
of focus state.

props.name: spellcheck
props.docs: If `true`, enable spellcheck on the input.

props.name: type
props.docs: Set the type of the input.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native `<input>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the specified `ion-searchbar`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the cancel button is clicked.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the clear input button is clicked.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input ocurred.

styles.name: --cancel-button-color
styles.docs: Color of the searchbar cancel button

styles.name: --clear-button-color
styles.docs: Color of the searchbar clear button

styles.name: --placeholder-font-style
styles.docs: Font style of the searchbar placeholder

styles.name: --placeholder-font-weight
styles.docs: Font weight of the searchbar placeholder
